Package server

This package contains the functionality for the server which is a command line program and updates the database directly according to the received messages from the Control Panel back-end.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BillboardAdmin
    The BillboardAdmin contains methods which interacts with the server and database when working with the Billboard Table.
    BillboardList
    The BillboardList is a class which is used as an serializable object to send billboard list to the control panel from the database result
    CpBillboard
    The CpBillboard is a serializable class which allows Control Panel objects to be sent into the server for storage
    CurrentSchedule
    The CurrentSchedule is a Serializable object which stores billboard information that is currently active to be sent to control panel and viewer.
    DbBillboard
    The DbBillboard is a serializable object hat stores billboard data to be sent to the Control Panel when requested.
    DbConnection
    The DbConnection class consists of basic connection methods to communicate with the database.
    DbUser
    The DbUser class contains methods when querying the User Table.
    ScheduleAdmin
    The ScheduleAdmin contains methods which interacts with the server and database when working with the Schedule Table.
    ScheduleInfo
    The ScheduleInfo is a class which is used as an serializable object to send particular schedule information to the control panel from the database result.
    ScheduleList
    The ScheduleList is a class which is used as an serializable object to send Schedule list to the control panel from the database result.
    Server
    The server class consists of the main logic of running the server.
    UserAdmin
    The UserAdmin class contains methods which interacts with the server and database when working with the User Table.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Server.Permission
    The four different permissions that are available for the user to have
    Server.ServerAcknowledge
    Server acknowledgments that are available and are sent to the Controller from the Server to indicate success or exception occurred.
